official-title.#text: To clarify the treatment under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act of health plans in which expatriates are the primary enrollees, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives April 29, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: Subject to

text.#text: expatriate health plans;
employers with respect to any such plans for which such employers are acting as plan sponsors; or
expatriate health insurance issuers with respect to coverage offered by such issuers under such plans.

by reference, coverage under an expatriate health plan shall be deemed to be minimum essential coverage under an eligible employer-sponsored plan as defined in

text.#text: For purposes of

header.#text: Minimum essential coverage and eligible employer-Sponsored plan
Qualified expatriates and dependents not United States health risk

text.#text: For purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , for calendar years after 2014, a qualified expatriate (and any dependent of such individual) enrolled in an expatriate health plan shall not be considered a United States health risk.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 9010 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:9010

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for calendar year 2014 with respect to any expatriate health insurance issuer shall be the amount which bears the same ratio to the fee amount determined by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:9010

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to such issuer under such section for such year (determined without regard to this paragraph) as—

text.#text: The fee under

the amount of premiums taken into account under such section with respect to such issuer for such year, less the amount of premiums for expatriate health plans taken into account under such section with respect to such issuer for such year, bears to
the amount of premiums taken into account under such section with respect to such issuer for such year.
In this section:

term.#tail: means a health insurance issuer that issues expatriate health plans.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (which may include dependents of such individuals) that meets each of the following standards:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:3/sp:B

term.#tail: means a group health plan, health insurance coverage offered in connection with a group health plan, or health insurance coverage offered to a group of individuals described in

text.#text: The term

Substantially all of the primary enrollees in such plan or coverage are qualified expatriates, with respect to such plan or coverage. In applying the previous sentence, an individual shall not be taken into account as a primary enrollee if the individual is not a national of the United States and resides in the country of which the individual is a citizen.

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: Substantially all of the benefits provided under the plan or coverage are not excepted benefits described in
The plan or coverage provides benefits for items and services, in excess of emergency care, furnished by health care providers—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in the country or countries in which the individual is present in connection with the individual’s employment, and such other country or countries as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:3/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: in the case of individuals described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in the country or countries as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expatriate Health Coverage Clarification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:3/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: in the case of individuals described in
In the case of an expatriate health plan that is a group health plan offered by a plan sponsor that—

also offers a qualifying minimum value domestic group health plan, the plan sponsor reasonably believes that the benefits provided by the expatriate health plan are actuarially similar to, or better than, the benefits provided under a qualifying minimum value domestic group health plan offered by that plan sponsor; or

does not also offer a qualifying minimum value domestic group health plan, the plan sponsor reasonably believes that the benefits provided by the expatriate health plan are actuarially similar to, or better than, the benefits provided under a qualifying minimum value domestic group health plan.

If the plan or coverage provides dependent coverage of children, the plan or coverage makes such dependent coverage available for adult children until the adult child turns 26 years of age, unless such individual is the child of a child receiving dependent coverage.
The plan or coverage—
is issued by an expatriate health plan issuer, or administered by an administrator, that maintains, with respect to such plan or coverage—
network provider agreements with health care providers that are outside of the United States; and
call centers in more than one country and accepts calls from customers in multiple languages; and
offers reimbursements for items or services under such plan or coverage in more than two currencies.

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: The plan or coverage, and the plan sponsor or expatriate health insurance issuer with respect to such plan or coverage, satisfies the provisions of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , which would otherwise apply to such a plan or coverage, and sponsor or issuer, if not for the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974/t:I/st:B/pt:7

term.#tail: means any of the following individuals:

text.#text: An individual who is a participant in a group health plan, who is an alien residing outside the United States, a national of the United States, lawful permanent resident, or nonimmigrant for whom there is a good faith expectation by the plan sponsor of the plan that, in connection with the individual’s employment, the individual is abroad for a total of not less than 180 days during any period of 12 consecutive months.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: An individual, such as a student or religious missionary, who is abroad, and who is a member of a group determined appropriate by the

quote.#tail: means a group health plan that is offered in the United States that meets the following requirements:
quote.#text: qualifying minimum value domestic group health plan

text.#text: Substantially all of the primary enrollees in the plan are not qualified expatriates, with respect to such plan.
